Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: trace of reserved band at rim, glazed (fired red) below; alternating lotus flower and rosette in added white outline with added red centres; below, band of alternating red and white dots above guilloche pattern; exterior: band of diagonal strokes at rim above paired hook maeanders between pairs of lines; below, lion (head, shoulder, foreleg and torso remaining) to right; below, trace of band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'Naukratis 1899' is marked in ink on the exterior of the fragment. The sherd probably comes from the same vessel as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.114.15.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2028) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
